intro: Psoralea keetii, commonly known as the Keet's psoralea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has compound leaves with small, rounded leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
